summary: Build an app for farmers called Kisan Kart.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Simple agricultural marketplace logo mark with text “Kisan Kart”, earthy tones (kisan-kart-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Wide hero banner illustration featuring farmers, crops, and a small marketplace stall in a clean flat style (kisan-kart-hero.dim_1600x600.png)

existing_features.title: Create the core frontend application structure for “Kisan Kart” with primary navigation and pages: Home, Browse Listings, Create Listing, My Listings, and About/Help.
Implement a coherent, distinctive visual theme for Kisan Kart (colors, typography, spacing, components) and apply it consistently across all pages.

Connect the frontend to the backend APIs to enable end-to-end listing workflows: create listing form submission, browse listings, view listing details, and manage the current user’s listings (edit/deactivate).
Add browsing utilities on the frontend: search by keyword (title/description), filter by category, and sort by newest and price (low-to-high / high-to-low).
Implement authentication using Internet Identity to identify the listing owner and to gate access to Create Listing and My Listings pages (prompt to sign in when not authenticated).
Add a listing detail page that includes a “Contact” section showing seller-provided contact text (e.g., phone/WhatsApp text field) stored in the listing, without integrating external messaging APIs.
Add basic client-side and backend-side validation for listing creation/editing (required fields, price >= 0, length limits) and display clear inline error messages in English.
Render generated static brand assets (logo and a simple hero banner) from frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the header and Home page.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create the Kisan Kart farmer app platform.

Implement backend data model and APIs to support marketplace listings, including creating, reading, updating, and deleting listings. Each listing must include: id, title, description, category, price (number), unit (text), location (text), images (optional URLs or asset references), owner (principal), createdAt, updatedAt, and status (active/inactive).
Add seed/sample data support for local development so the Browse Listings page can display a few example listings when running locally (without requiring manual entry every time).
